law.full_text:
ENFORCEMENT.
a. Civil Action. Any aggrieved person may enforce the provisions of this article by means of a civil action.
b. Injunction.
1. Any person who commits, or proposes to commit, an act in violation of this article may be enjoined therefrom by any court of competent jurisdiction.
2. Action for injunction under this subsection may be brought by any aggrieved person, by the City Attorney, or by any person or entity which will fairly and adequately represent the interests of the protected class.

unit.label: article
unit.name: Discrimination On The Basis Of Sexual Orientation

unit.catch_line: Housing And Other Real Estate Transactions.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
ENFORCEMENT. (§ 49.77)
ENFORCEMENT. a. Civil Action. Any aggrieved person may enforce the provisions of this article by means of a civil action. b. Injunction. 1. Any person who commits, or proposes to commit, an act in violation of this article may be enjoined therefrom by any court of competent jurisdiction. 2. Action for injunction under this subsection may be brought by any aggrieved person, by the City Attorney, or by any person or entity which will fairly and adequately represent the interests of the protected class.
law.html:
ENFORCEMENT.

a. Civil Action. Any aggrieved person may enforce the provisions of this article by means of a civil action.

b. Injunction.

1. Any person who commits, or proposes to commit, an act in violation of this article may be enjoined therefrom by any court of competent jurisdiction.

2. Action for injunction under this subsection may be brought by any aggrieved person, by the City Attorney, or by any person or entity which will fairly and adequately represent the interests of the protected class.
